definition: without restraint, not literal, people who are free, make (assets) available
details:
adverb
- without restraint
= synonyms: loose
adjective
- not literal
= synonyms: loose
- completely wanting or lacking
= synonyms: innocent, barren, destitute, devoid
- unconstrained or not chemically bound in a molecule or not fixed and capable of relatively unrestricted motion
= example: unconstrained or not chemically bound in a molecule or not fixed and capable of relatively unrestricted motion
- not fixed in position
= synonyms: detached
- able to act at will
- not held in servitude
= example: not held in servitude
- not occupied or in use
= example: not occupied or in use
- not taken up by scheduled activities
= example: not taken up by scheduled activities
= synonyms: spare
- costing nothing
= synonyms: complimentary, gratuitous, costless, gratis
noun
- people who are free
= example: people who are free
= synonyms: free people
verb
- make (assets) available
= synonyms: release, unblock, unfreeze
- let off the hook
= synonyms: justify, absolve
- free or remove obstruction from
= example: free or remove obstruction from
= synonyms: disengage
- remove or force out from a position
= synonyms: dislodge
- release (gas or energy) as a result of a chemical reaction or physical decomposition
= synonyms: liberate
- part with a possession or right
= synonyms: release
- relieve from
= synonyms: rid, disembarrass
- grant freedom to
= example: grant freedom to
= synonyms: release
- free from obligations or duties
= synonyms: discharge
- make (information) available for publication
= synonyms: release
- grant relief or an exemption from a rule or requirement to
= synonyms: exempt, relieve
